NEW YORK, Nov 19 (IFR) - Affirm, the buy now, pay later player that is now Amazon’s exclusive partner, seized upon recent momentum by raising an upsized US$1.5bn on Thursday from the sale of a five-year CB issue.

Joint bookrunners Morgan Stanley and JP Morgan bumped the offering size to US$1.5bn from US$1.25bn ahead of pricing at a zero-percent coupon and 55% conversion premium, through the aggressive ends of 0%–0.25% and 47.5%–52.5% talk marketed during the day.

Affirm shares did fall 8.3% to US$139.13 while the offering was being marketed.

The issue marks Affirm’s first ECM outing since it went public in January via a US$1.4bn all-primary offering priced at US$49.

In something of a coup, Affirm a week earlier signed an agreement to be the BNPL provider to Amazon exclusively through to January 2023.

The CB marks the latest in a progression of financings by Affirm to diversify its funding following securitisations of loans in February and July.

(Stephen Lacey)
